docs.lead_paragraph: Within certain restrictions, a Federal taxpayer may deduct the cost of medical care for himself, his wife and his dependents. He may claim the deduction, of course, only if he itemizes all deductions, rather than taking the 10 per cent standard deduction or the minimum-standard deduction, in figuring his tax return due Friday night.

headline.main: Personal Finance; Tax Deductions for Medical Care Outlined as Federal Deadline Nears Personal Finance: On Medical Costs

docs.abstract: advice on deductions for med expenses

docs.lead_paragraph: LEXINGTON, Ky. IN a small room, the shade drawn against the sunshine, a young man lies curled up fetuslike on his hospital bed. He has pulled the Army blanket close to him. Then, as the door opens, he slowly sits up. Bone thin, with prematurely graying hair and puzzled blue eyes, the patient seems eager for help and eager to please the crisp young psychiatrist who enters the room.

headline.main: A Visit to Narco; 'I've Searched and Searched, and I Can't Find Anything in My Background That Made Me Go on Drugs' A Visit to Narco Probably Lexington's greatest weakness is the lack of an after-care program

docs.lead_paragraph: When James A. Perkins, president of Cornell University, last year asked state authorities to investigate the use of drugs by students, one fellow university president expressed his admiration. "A lot of us have been sweeping the problem under the rug, and the rug is getting pretty lumpy," he said.
docs.abstract: comment on growing use of illicit drugs by coll students
